sentence.title: Le Petit Prince
text: When a mystery is too overpowering, one dare not disobey.
Absurd as it might seem to me,
a thousand miles from any human habitation and in danger of death,
I took out of my pocket a sheet of paper and my fountainpen.

sentence.title: Tom Sawyer
text: Aunt Polly hears a faint noise behind her,
and turns around just in time to seize a skinny young boy
with a mouth full of strawberry jam.
Tom, look at your mouth.

sentence.title: Alice`s Adventures in Wonderland
text: Alice felt too sleepy to play, and there was nobody to play with.
When Alice began to get up, she saw a rabbit.
Alice often saw rabbits in the garden, but this rabbit was different.
He had large, pink ears, like most rabbits,
but unlike most rabbits, he was wearing a blue coat and had a watch in his hand.

sentence.title: The Frog Prince
text: Once upon a time, there was a young princess named Polly.
She lived in a beautiful castle with her father and her two sisters.
The princess had a favorite toy, golden ball.
The girls chased each other and threw this ball for a while.
They took off their shoes and put their feet in the river.

sentence.title: Ali Baba and the Forty Thieves
text: Long ago in Persia, there lived two brothers.
Kasim was a rich merchant, but Ali Baba was only a poor woodcutter.
While Kasim ran a large store in town,
Ali Baba spent his time collecting firewood.
He would gather twigs and branches to sell at the market.
